website_summaries.verdict: It's hard to match this kettlebell's performance for the price, making it the best value for your money.
pros: The CAP's solid cast iron construction holds up well to repeated use
cons: Handle is a bit narrow for larger hands

customer_reviews.title: ProductSupport will ignore you
customer_reviews.text: I was a huge fan of CAP kettle bells until i had a problem and contacted support. Kettlebell arrived with box and packaging smashed, paint was chipped down to iron in multiple places. I contacted support and they replied immediately asking for multiple methods of proof and documentation. I provided it all and they never responded or replaced the product. 3 more follow up emails all ignored. Will switch to another brand. Not worth the premium price.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent kettlebells, handle could be bigger tho.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these kettlebells a few months ago and they have been great. They are the claimed weight, a key criteria to sucess. They have a nice rubber coating on them so that you don't rip up your hands using them. Only reason I took off a single star, the loop to hold the kettlebell isn't very wide. I am a slightly shorter than average male and felt that it was barely wide enough for one hand, let alone some two handed exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in great shape. I love this kind of kettlebell. It has a thick handle, which is great to help build gripping strength and gripping endurance. This might be too thick for some women with small hands. The kettlebell feels great. I love the coating on it. The length of the handle is perfect for snatches because of where it lands on the forearm (not the wrist). I love it. It's most of an old school style kettlebell. The price is amazing! The shipping alone is usually $20 and up depending on the weight of the KB. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: KeepItReal24/7

customer_reviews.title: Severely uneven enamel coating
customer_reviews.text: This came covered in enamel, totally unevenly coated, and not even covering the handle -- where you literally always hold the thing -- making the grip somewhat irritating, then painful, and practically unusable. I might cover it with electric tape or something. Waste of money. Could have bought a cast iron, non-coated bell and put some grip tape around the handle without this uneven mess. Seriously, it's like my 4-year old nephew poured enamel paint on this thing; drips and gaps everywhere. At this point, I don't even know what point the "paint job" serves. It's certainly not aesthetically pleasing or helpful.
customer_reviews.author: ylre

customer_reviews.title: Wish They Would Come Back in Stock
customer_reviews.text: I know, it's a kettlebell. What can you say? Good quality, good price when I got it. Looks like they have changed the line somewhat and the prices have risen since the work slowdowns. Hopefully prices will stabilize again soon since competitors are charging four times as much for similar items. Kettlebells feel natural in your hands, unlike straight bars. Just remember that after buying it, you gotta use it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Worst kettlebell I have ever seen.
customer_reviews.text: This thing came with giant chips all over it. I’m not sure what exactly is on the inside; if it is in fact cast iron, it’s the worst casting I’ve ever seen. The thing is shaped like an egg and the paint appears to have been hand painted on by a child. I get that this is a cheap bell, but wow.. what a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!! HIGH QUALITY 80 LB HIGH BLACK KETTLE BELL !!! RECOMMENED!!! THANKS CAP!!! 3 JULY '19
customer_reviews.text: ACTUAL PHOTOGRAPH! HANDLE IS WIDE AND PERFECT FOR MY BIG HANDS. I just received my 80 lb kettle bell. It is in perfect condition, no chips, dents or burrs anywhere! Perfect! It is a SUPER high gloss black marble. It is exactly 80.0 lbs on the scale. Some customers complained that their kettle bells (OF VARIOUS SIZES) had paint chips etc. All it is ... is high gloss enamel paint and you can get a small can at Walmart and EASILY touch up if necessary. I plan on using it on a carpet and rubber mats. Order yours today you will be pleased! :)
customer_reviews.author: US Marine Semper Fi

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality. Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: First off, the out of the four I received only one of them was not damaged. For being purely weight in a box I would have expected better packaging. The boxes were so destroyed the shipping label was barely visible, and I am surprised the boxes even made it to me. Two of them were cracked and shattered. On the two others there is excess material or voids in the coating making them very painful to grip. For anyone looking into getting started with an at home kettlebell workout save your money and buy powder coated quality kettlebells.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Very Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time on this product. It arrived with missing enamel on the handle. This was not damaged in shipping. This imperfection could cause tears in skin and injury to fingers. I contacted the company, and they exchanged this kettle bell with another one, but it also had missing enamel on the handle. I purchased my next Kettlebell from Rep fitness, and had a great experience. Rep has a very well made product, excellent packaging, and a great reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Thnrkly

customer_reviews.title: I hate kettlebells
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing. I pick it up. I swing it around. I put it down. If you are looking for a great work out kettlebells are a great tool. This one has a nice smooth surface. I work with it twice a week and haven't had any complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Helmbrecht

customer_reviews.title: Can’t ask for anything better
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, accurate weight, and works great for a full body workout. Really the only tool you need for a home workout when just starting out. However, after I dropped it on concrete and noticed some chipping on the bottom enamel, I question if this is a concrete mold instead of cast iron. But, like I said accurate weight and it didn’t crack I can’t complain.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great kettlebell. Handles are much thicker and narrower (not ...
customer_reviews.text: Great kettlebell. Handles are much thicker and narrower (not as comfortable to get both hands in for kettlebell swings). The polished finish is nice as well. And although polished, we don't have a problem with it feeling like it wants to slip out of our hands. We ordered a set in increments of 5#'s from 10-50#'s. A few of our kettlebells arrived defective with the hard coated enamel completely chipped. Most kettlebells arrived in their own individual packaging and others were plainly bubble wrapped and placed in boxes too big for their size, meaning the kettlebell rolled around inside. We experienced chipping in both types of packaging. Amazon has excellent customer service and resolved the issues with the defective kettlebells.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie C.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for budget workouts where your gear has to be more functional than attractive.
customer_reviews.text: Just started working with kettlebells. There is an imperfection on the paint on the inside of the handle about 1 inch in diameter it looks like they missed a spot. Not a big deal, it just has to be heavy not pretty. However it looked nothing like some of the bad pics I’ve seen on here, I must have lucked out Other the imperfection mentioned the rest of the finish is pristine.
customer_reviews.author: Lugodbody

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged, otherwise fine for the price
customer_reviews.text: I debated giving this 3 stars instead because the amount of damage it arrived with is excessive and they really need to improve their packaging and/or quality control to prevent so many people receiving them damaged. As a kettlebell, though, it’s okay. I prefer the comfort and finish of other kettlebells, but this was more affordable so that’s the trade off.
customer_reviews.author: ssnj

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatisfied!
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this product. Kettlebells are not inexpensive and to purchase a 35lb and it arrive heavily scarred up was very disappointing. I waited weeks for delivery and then to have to product look “old and very worn” was the reason I will not purchase from this seller any more. Extremely unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: BDawg 1536

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality kettle bells for home workouts!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two 10# Kettlebells so that I can do some weight bearing exercises at home when I don't feel like going to my group exercise classes. I debated about the weight, but figure that 10 pounds is about right for both arm exercises and doing lunges. The kettle bells are well made from cast iron and coated with a black enamel - so there is no need to worry about rusting. At some point in time I might graduate to a higher weight, but am pretty happy with these - I am a 50 year old woman in reasonable, but not tip top shape. Just trying to keep moving and to stay strong as I age.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for daily use
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for quite a while. Both the 35lb and the 45lb. They have held up extremely well against everything. The slamming into concrete, multiple moves, and daily use. The paint has barely chipped after all of it. The one issue I have with it is the grip could be knurled for easier gripping. With gloves it’s really not an issue but would be a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: RyeBri

customer_reviews.title: Nice but damaged coating.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these (one 15 lbs and one 25 lbs) they arrived in separate boxes but both had chips out of the coating on the handles. This is really the only part that needs to be smooth. The jagged chips would have been quite uncomfortable so I mixed some epoxy to fill in the damaged areas. Once dry a quick sanding and they were back to being smooth. For the price I am still pretty pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jeff p

customer_reviews.title: For beginners, I do not recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: For beginners, I do not recommend this, you can get injured.Beginners should start with a maximum of 5 pounds.To properly lift a weight of 45 pounds, and not once, but ten or more times, you need to train for a long time if you have never done it.I can lift more weight, and two at once.For me, this is not very much weight.
customer_reviews.author: ALEKSANDR MANULIS

customer_reviews.title: If you want some really nice kettle-bells - look no further - get these... Plus the price is very reasonable...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product(s) as usual. Have purchased ten kettle bells so far and all have been up to standard high quality. Only very infrequently the package comes in a little mashed (torn up); but contents seems to survive in spite of delivery system. Will definitely buy more from CAP if needed - highly recommended. The solid black units they sell are more than adequate to get the job done. You will especially like the big (oversize) handles - lets you really get a "grip" on things as they say. Get some - they're just plain dandy.
customer_reviews.author: Inquiring Minds

customer_reviews.title: Handle thickness might be the dealbreaker
customer_reviews.text: On the 45 lb bell, the diameter of the handle seems quite a bit larger than standard. Much larger than any dumbbell I've used. The handle thickness and the glossy enamel coating, together, make changing hand position during a move awkward and not smooth. It's ok for swings and rows. But I can't get my risk straight in the rack position or during presses. At this weight, it a recipe for bruised forearms and bad form.
customer_reviews.author: J Haitch

customer_reviews.title: Great Bell at a Stellar Price
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect condition. No chips. No pits. Smooth handle. Seams don't protrude and are smooth. This bell swings with ease. Kettlebells are a great total body workout and they don't take up much space. If you're looking to increase strength, flexibility, mobility and your cardiovascular health, this tool can get you there. You only need one bell of each weight not a pair like Dumbbells. It's best to practice form before moving up in weight to avoid injury and become efficient with the moves. A good kettlebell regimen can get you in shape in quickly in less time than more 'conventional' methods. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Marble-Matrix

customer_reviews.title: High quality kettlebell
customer_reviews.text: Kettlebell based routines are some of my wife's favorites. She had a few GoFit brand kettlebells and was looking for heavier options when we found these CAP ones. They are still cast iron - nice and compact. Compared to GoFit: --Handle is smoother and a little bit thicker than GoFit --All black - some shiny, some matte - no plastic coating --Same handle room Ours arrived with no chips/rusting like some other reviewers have mentioned. We also use this on a softer/rubber tile gym floor or outside on the grass, so we don't have any concern about chipping. We both really just couldn't get over the price difference between these and GoFit brands. These are the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: Great for Turkish Get-Ups
customer_reviews.text: The 60lb CAP Cast Iron Kettlebell showed up with a few dings but it wasn't because they didn't try to pack it well. The finish is great and the handle design is excellent with a single caveat. The 60lb CAP is not ideal for two-handed swings, the handle is just a little to narrow. My glove size is extra-large. I bought this kettlebell for Turkish Get-Ups and it is GREAT for that. The handle design is a benefit, allows a stable grip and a firm, comfortable perch on the forearm. If you are looking for a 60lber to do two-handed swings, I would choose a YesforAll or TDS.
customer_reviews.author: stanrilla

customer_reviews.title: 30lb kettleball
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this 30lb kettleball for home workouts because the gym in my building is close due to COVID19. The vinyl on the kettleball is damaged in several places but I guess it doesn't need to be pretty in order to serve its purpose. Overall satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Suro Tinu

customer_reviews.title: The coating will flake off
customer_reviews.text: At first, I loved the value of this kettlebell, however, both of my handles have chipped off completely to bare metal within a few months. Once a chip starts, the rest starts coming off in large chunks very quickly. I have owned Ader kettlebells for the past 3 years and haven't had this issue. Chips of course are inevitable, but the coating on this brand reminds me of the candy shell on an M&M. It doesn't adhere to the metal very good and I can flake large chunks off with my fingernails. I will probably sand blast them and paint them with something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great bells, great price
customer_reviews.text: These are good kettlebells. Like other reviewers suggested, the paint can chip. But so what if it does? Don't eat the paint chips and you'll be fine. The bells are pretty smooth finish. The weight is spot on. The handles are pretty smooth which is good for exercises where you want them to rotate smoothly, like if you are doing a clean press or something like that. That said, in some cases they get slippery if your hands get sweaty so just be careful. The price is very reasonable for these and if you use Amazon Prime the shipping will be free. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Digelectric

customer_reviews.title: Uneven bottom + enamel chipped off on arrival
customer_reviews.text: My therapist has these exact kettlebells, so I ordered the 20# one. I was very disappointed today when mine showed up with a huge enamel chip already off the kettlebell. In addition, the cast must have been defective, as the bottom is very rough on bottom in 2 places opposite each other. I am sending it back. Will try to find something local.
customer_reviews.author: Runner

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect much
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. The plate in the side of the 30# bell that indicates the size was cracked and falling off right out of the box. Probably due to severely inadequate packaging for shipping. Two other bells have such a poor finish on them that they will probably need to be ground down and repainted. Only 1 of 4 bells from the set is of the quality I would expect, and my expectations were quite low considering they are essentially hunks of iron to be swung around for a workout. They'll be functional enough, so I'll keep them, but probably should have spent a bit more to get bells that don't look like factory rejects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Workout of all time
customer_reviews.text: Whew what a great purchase. Nice and smooth, no wobbles in the make of this 25lb kettlebell. As far as the workout is concerned, it’s the best workout I ever had in my life. Kettlebell workouts are GREAT!!! I feel the power already in my muscles. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Dori Martinez

customer_reviews.title: I'm a personal trainer and I say it's a good gift!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a personal trainer so when my brother in law asked me for a kettlebell, I knew I had to find one that would ship free (thanks Amazon Prime), and that wouldn't be an annoying vinyl one that would fall apart quickly. Don't get those fancy colored ones made out of softer materials, they fall apart!!!! This may not be the prettiest, but you're working out, who cares about pretty? This does the job just fine. My brother in law loves it by the way. Win!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Chipped.
customer_reviews.text: There are two factors that are important to know about this kettlebell. The Good: The handle is smooth. This really helps avoid blisters like i've experienced with rougher, more textured kettlebells. You'll get a great workout! Best price on amazon! The bad: It's not solid metal. I dropped mine and the black coating chipped right off on part of the ball. It's still fine, but this is not a genuine metal kettlebell. If this were to chip in the handle it would make the kettlebell totally unusable!
customer_reviews.author: Baron

customer_reviews.title: Coating imperfections make it difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: Would be a good review if the coating didn't have an imperfection right on the handle. This means I need to find good gloves to use or risk cutting my hand with every use.
customer_reviews.author: Cami M

customer_reviews.title: where's the rest of the order?
customer_reviews.text: received the only half of the order and a 1x 20lb kettle that wasn't even part of the listing. Something went wrong and I'm hoping someone can make it right. If not I will have to otherwise I will have to file a claim with my credit card company since the total order was worth over $500 and right now I'm missing $200+ in weights, and that is not something I don't plan on just brushing off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kettlebells rock!
customer_reviews.text: Kettlebells are such a versatile weight, and my CAP bell has been a consistent companion in my workout routines for 2.5 years now. The handle does seem to be a bit thicker than other brands/designs, so that's something to keep in mind, but I have dainty woman hands with long fingers and I handle the 20 pounder just fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Evans

customer_reviews.title: it's nice to actually get it in new condition
customer_reviews.text: Well you order a new product, it's nice to actually get it in new condition... mine looked like it's spent the last 3 years rolling around the back of a UPS truck ( which might actually be the case, maybe this is the one everyone keeps returning!) Anyways functionally it's what I wanted, a 50 lb kettlebell so I'm keeping it, still pretty annoyed it's not, you know, a new kettlebell, knock 20 bucks off and call it used guys, cmon...
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Not a Dumbell
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I weighted it and it is actually 35 pounds of cast iron, with black paint bake on. I was using a twenty five pound kettle bell and graduated to the 35 pound. A book I also purchased "Kettlebell Conditioning: 4-Phase BodyBell Training System with Australia's..." came in mighty handy... You really have to warm up before using this big boy. If you want to try a different type of workout, this is it. A 10-15 minute workout, will bring the strongest person "to there knees." It is recommended, do some reading (like book shown here) and start with a kettlebell (or bells) of a lighter weight to permit you to do the exercises properly.
customer_reviews.author: RangeRyder

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I have just started working out with kettlebells and these are great! He used 25lbs and I use 15lbs which seems like a good starting place. These have a good grip so we’re not as worried about flinging them into our tv.
customer_reviews.author: Anna W.

customer_reviews.title: Price is great, came in pristine condition and well packaged
customer_reviews.text: The 15 lb CAP Kettlebell is exactly what I was looking for. Price is great, came in pristine condition and well packaged. I see some people received items that had the coating coming off but mine does not have that issue. Honestly, probably wouldn't care if it had come with some cosmetic damage considering what it is used for. It is a solid bell with a comfortable handle. Will buy this brand again when I need to go up in lbs.
customer_reviews.author: justjane

customer_reviews.title: Punishment, thy name kettlebell
customer_reviews.text: I knew I wanted a kettlebell, only question was about the weight. I was about ready to order a 20 pounder when I clicked on 25 out of curiosity. For some reason it is cheaper shipped for a 25 than 20, go figure!? This thing kicks my butt on a daily basis. Good news, I know it is working out nearly every muscle possible. In terms of quality, it is definitely a well constructed piece of equipment. The coating is slightly slippery, especially after a hard workout. I'd advise two handed grips during swings for this very reason. I'd definitely buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: kazper

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sure it shouldn’t look like that.
customer_reviews.text: Upon unboxing, this is what I received. Super awesome. Is it still functional? Sure. But I didn’t pay to get a kettlebell with chunks missing. Looks like I’m stuck with it as there’s no way in hell I’m paying to return it. Pretty disappointed because who likes paying for damaged goods but what can ya do?
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Well packaged and functional bell
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered several weights from amazon in the past. Most were plate style weights though, never a kettle bell. I was a little worried about chips or cracks in the enamel during shipping but to my surprise, the weight came in perfect shape. The box from the manufacturer was well packaged and held up well during its transit. The item itself is solid too, exactly what I was expecting. Should I need another in a larger size in the future, this will certainly be the brand I chose for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jake H.

customer_reviews.title: 30lb Kettlebell
customer_reviews.text: My kettlebell was well packaged (this time) however it wasn't on a prior shipment or return. It was obviously bounced around and pretty well chipped. However disappointing this was, it is purely cosmetic and doesn't affect the weight or performance of the kettlebell (you actually may chip them when doing the 2 kettlebell workouts. Some trainers actually recommend removing the paint on the handle and treating it with chalk anyway. You could go heavier which is great for strength but for conditioning all you have to do is increase the repetitions heck who counts reps when you are timing a 10 minute set. Now that is a workout!
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The handle is rough and it looked like it had been dropped in gravel
customer_reviews.text: Ordered because the Amazon basic kettle bell, which I ordered previously, was out of stock. This one is nowhere near the quality of the Amazon basic. The handle is rough and it looked like it had been dropped in gravel. Paint is chipped off in a number of places. Future purchases will be the Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: MLV

customer_reviews.title: it works just dont expect 100% quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of the exact same product, brand new15lb kettlebells, so i can work out both arms at once in unison. But one is an obvious return with chips in the coating an possibly another make, not shiny at all, and the other in a box and is shiny brand new with tags still on it. =(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Me GUSTA!
customer_reviews.text: Feels heavier - like I got an extra value. And if you listen really closely,...you can hear the delivery guy dropping f-bombs outside your door when it arrives!
customer_reviews.author: Mark - Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality, excellent machining
customer_reviews.text: So there is a kettlebell craze in the fitness world these days, and I must say it took me a while to follow it (and not because I doubted it, just that what was the routine I was going to do to get maximum results). This Cap kettlebell is a joy to workout with; it's supremely machined and that's what really counts when looking at weights and metal exercise equipment. How and when you use it is entirely up to you. The grip is the perfect thickness and the sheen coating is not slippery (although using gloves assists with any weight-training grip, and that's important to note).
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B. Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Kettlebells!
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice, high quality kettlebells. I love these things and would definitely recommend! Here are my thoughts. Pros: - Nicely weighted - Nice powder coating exterior - Flat bottom for standing upright - Price (when on sale) - OEM packaging kept well contained and free of any defects Cons: - No stippling to handle for better grip, Can get slippery with sweaty palms - Handle thickness (wish it was a tad bit smaller)
customer_reviews.author: locochristopher

customer_reviews.title: Clean, smooth, weight and balance correct.
customer_reviews.text: I was actually surprised how perfect this was. Clean, smooth, weight and balance correct. Shape is good, almost perfect round so comfortable to hold close to body and swing. This is way nicer than the ones they had a Sport Chalet and Sport Authority and less expensive. I really researched a lot because I read reviews about problems and have handled lots of these kettle bells that are sub-par. I almost went with the more expensive competition CAP model with the powder coating, but I'm glad I got this one. I will likely order other sizes based on how much use this gets.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Mohajerin

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to Workout Routine
customer_reviews.text: I mainly train with body weight exercises due to space constraints. This bell is a great addition to the routines. I like the handle style—comfortable and does not dig into collarbone. Smooth finish but you can still grip it and it doesn’t pull on shirt like some of the rougher finished bells I’ve seen at gyms.
customer_reviews.author: Northfox

customer_reviews.title: Kettlebell Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of a kettlebell weight before and was a little skeptical when I bought it. But I saw quite a few exercises for these weights on a major video website so I decided to give it a try. Since I'm not lifting for massive size but to stay in shape, these weights work great. There are lots of exercises you can do with these things and they really do build muscle and tone you. The key is to get the proper weight for you. That being said, I believe anyone wanting to get back into shape and tone up (male or female) will be very please with the results of the kettlebell weight.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Shutters

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs to
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for some core work. It showed up dinged as sh't but not the sellers fault. Overall, impressed with the weight and durability. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RCadi

customer_reviews.title: Love this smaller shape with the big handle, BUT the paint chips badly.
customer_reviews.text: At the gym, the kettlebells are huge compared to this one, so I bought this for home and travel for the various kettlebell exercises like swings, around-the-worlds, halos, figures-8s, etc. I personally prefer this shape. The price is quite reasonable in relation to some of the kettlebells, but the paint chips badly if you drop one on a hard surface or against another kettlebell. However, this does not affect the weight or integrity of the kettlebell. Maybe it makes my kettlebells look seriously used, which they are!
customer_reviews.author: jennyN

customer_reviews.title: Wont sit flat, wobbles
customer_reviews.text: I dont know what happened with the 10 LB CAP kettlebell, but its uneven on the bottom and wont sit flat. I just sent the first one back and just received the replacement, which is even worse than the first one! I have an entire set of these by CAP and the other size weights are fine. I would like to have the second replacement, replaced, but I dont know if it would be worth the effort if they are all casted from the same mold.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Great basic hunk of metal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to have for quick impromptu workouts at home. The prices on amazon are far better than they are in store. I hesitated after reading some of the reviews stating that the handles break, but I figured that those were results of poor welding for that individual item. The only reason I am giving ours a 4 rather than a 5 is because for what they do cost, our coating did have a chip in it (and I expect it to chip more as we continue to use it). I would recommend this for basic home-gym use!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Searle

customer_reviews.title: Great kettlebell
customer_reviews.text: This is my first kettlebell, and it is easy to use, made well, with a great price. It is also easy to grip, and great if you are just starting with one.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: It is what it says it is...a kettlebell
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kettle bell and an adjustable one. I am returning the adjustable one. The product is to the point and gets the workout done. The price is great, much better then the local stores- so if you are out shipping around- stop wasting time because I've already done it- and this is the best price you will find (unless prices go up drastically for whatever reason). I did buy some gloves because the workout I do with the kettle bell does begin to hurt my hands- with that doing said, I don't think it has anything to do with the item, just my sensitive girl hands =)
customer_reviews.author: Payton

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Kettlebells
customer_reviews.text: I have used kettlebells for a couple of years now and find that people have strong personal preferences about them. For me, these are the best. They fit my hands well, I like the smooth finish and even distribution of weight.
customer_reviews.author: 5Star

customer_reviews.title: Broken. Even the replacements.
customer_reviews.text: The first set arrived in multiple shipments and were broken. So we ordered a replacement. This also arrived broken and we got the 3 smaller ones and then the 30lb one took a week to arrive, apparently getting lost some where according to the tracking info.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered. A 60 + 80 lb kettlebell, the 60 was fine but the 1st 80 lb kettlebell was warped and misshapen and its black finish had been bashed very badly in several areas (sizable) so I returned and another 80lb was sent out. It is the correct shape but again the handle where u grip is damaged and so is the outer casing. Very poor overall service as I am now forced for a 3rd to contact responsible parties.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip F. Carr

customer_reviews.title: 70lb bell doesnt have enough room for two hands.
customer_reviews.text: Ihave 5 different weights and they all have enough room for two hands except the 70lb one I got. Its totally useless for what I wanted it for
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Legit intro kettlebell!
customer_reviews.text: One problem with small kettlebells is that the handle gets too narrow. There are a few things I like about this kettlebell. For a 10 pounder it has a nice wide handle. The handle is also nice and smooth which is easier on the hands. Further, this thing has a decent horn on it. I am an apartment manager and Crossfit instructor. I bought this for the apartment gym. I wanted something that our residents could use and were not likely to slip a disk using. I also wanted inexpensive. This is a great beginners kettlebell to introduce technique and form. It is ideal for women that have little experience with weights as it is not an intimidating size.
customer_reviews.author: Vulcangreen

customer_reviews.title: Simple design, durable.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived alright, although the packaging didn't (pictures to follow). These kettlebells are pretty solid, I have several different kinds and these are some of the simpler, but more durably designed I've had. They are just metal with a thick clearcoat, no rubber or other covering (don't drop on tiles or wood). They have a wide enough grip to do goblet squats, sumo deadlift high pulls, two handed kettlebell swings, and a large enough space in the handle to do kettlebell snatches without your hands feeling cramped for space. I have fairly big hands, so if they work for me, they probably will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Overall pleased.  Quality Control Lacking
customer_reviews.text: Overall pleased with my set but quality control is lacking. Purchase one set of 10-15-20-25-30 Kettle Bells, but the 10 lb, was received cracked and missing enamel coating. It's not worth the effort to return. I was planning to order a second set to have pairs of each, but I'm not sure based on quality of the 10 lb bell.
customer_reviews.author: Fit Family

customer_reviews.title: Great if tight on space!
customer_reviews.text: It's been a few months now after I bought this kettlebell. The handle gets slick if you start getting sweaty during a workout due to the enamel coating but wearing gloves helps. For the $35 I paid for it I have gotten great workouts out of it. I definitely feel a lot stronger doing these ballistic movements and it is a great compliment to a pair of dumbbells for more exercise variety. The kettlebell is still in great condition and looks great in my room.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: it works fine. My hands don't smell after using it
customer_reviews.text: OK, so the kettlebell is a kettlebell, it works fine. My hands don't smell after using it, bonus there. HOWEVER, the packaging, wow. A piece of cardboard. Yeah, the delivery people aren't real gentle with them, mine came chipped. I don't know what happened to my replacement, but I just have the chipped one now. I don't plan on getting it wet or anything, but guessing the life of it isn't going to be as long. They *really*need to work on their shipping. A plastic bag over it inside a thin cardboard box with strapping around it is not a lot of protection. :/
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great kettlebell, comfortable to hold
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a kettleball to start workouts at home in between days that I go to the gym. I went with the 30 lb kettlebell to start with, and it's worked out well for me, a middle-aged, fairly fit guy. I shopped around and liked the finish and smoothness of the CAP kettlebell, as well as the diameter and shape of the handle. I just found these more comfortable. And the price was reasonable. I'm surprised that you can get something so heavy sent with free shipping. It was well-packaged. I'll be buying more as I expand my exercise routines.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware! Item not new!
customer_reviews.text: Item was heavily used for many years. Coating chipped off in many places! Horrible. This was a gift, not able to give for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: AlpacaVenom

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, quality, but slightly slippery.
customer_reviews.text: One of the better kettlebells I've owned. Sleek design, good weight distribution, and good grip. CAP kettlebell fits well for both two-hand and one-hand exercises. While I do find the vinyl coating a bit slippery when I get sweating it is more comfortable than others I've tried. That slight slipperiness, though, is more comfortable for swings, etc. I like the weight distribution (it doesn't feel lopsided or too bottom heavy). I also appreciate it's slim design (for the weight). It nicely tucks away and I've had not issues with marking. I will definitely go back to CAP for future barbells when my weight requirements change.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Cook

customer_reviews.title: Expect it to come with dings
customer_reviews.text: I know shipping a 45lb kettlebell isn't the easiest thing, but the first one I got was pretty trashed, the coating was chipped and removed on a significant portion of it. They offered me an exchange and this one has about 5 small dings. It is usable and seems like a quality kettlebell, just don't be surprised if it shows up slightly damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a kettlebell
customer_reviews.text: Looks like the picture has a smooth handle which is great for kettlebell swings. Feels like 15 lbs I have not weighed it but it is slightly lighter then my 17 lb son, who works pretty good as a weight himself :) I have small hands and can hold the kettlebell easily with one hand two are a little squished but could work. Some one with medium or large hands may have trouble holding this with two hands. I am using it for single arm kettlebell swings. It was packed well by amazon in two different boxes. I'll be back for more in different weights.
customer_reviews.author: Thewife

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: I now have 6 of these kettlebells in various sizes. Every one has been delivered in perfect condition though sometimes I wonder how as the packaging has come almost completely shredded a couple times. The handles are a bit thick for me but not enough to be a problem. The finish is SO great and has kept calluses to a minimum and my hands aren't torn up. I weigh each weight on my scale before using and they have all been accurate to a few ounces. This is the kettlebell I recommend to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi H

customer_reviews.title: pro gym product at home!
customer_reviews.text: loved the kettlebells they are just like the ones at my gym! one of the kettlebells was chipped and I emailed the company and they sent me a brand new one! very happy with my purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ketlebell and I was told to look for certain things like get at least 30 pounds and get a handle that could provide a good two handed grip. The grip on this is perfect. I was not doing any exercise routine and learned that kettlebell workouts are actually fun and will not take overwhelming amounts of time. This CAP kettlebell will give you everything you need to start a workout routine. It does not take much room, it seems to be a high quality product and the price is good.
customer_reviews.author: 5Star

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Clearly damaged before shipping, since the original packaging has a hole with tape over it and the outer box didn't. I'd consider that good enough compared to some of the other photos in the reviews. Measured 44.8 pounds consistently. Close enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: DZ

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine
customer_reviews.text: I needed a kettlebell between my 52 and 72 pounders. It was being too hard to transition from the first to the second. My others are from Dragondoor, the gold standard in kettlebells. I got this one because it was much cheaper than Dragondoor. I was a bit afraid that the smooth enamel would make it hard to hold on to, but there is not much difference between it and the less smooth iron handles on my other ones. I do recommend that you get some climbers/gymnasts chalk if you are going to be working out hard. Your hands can get slippery with sweat and then any KB is hard to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Vekert

customer_reviews.title: Great Kettle Bell!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this at the beginning of the year, so it was at a sell price. We have been looking for a 35-lb kettle bell reasonably priced for a while. This is a great kettle bell for a wonderful price. It does everything one would expect out of kettle bell, and the black coating has been tough. It isn't a rubber coating as some of the kettle bells we have seen, its just painted but it does every thing we need it to do!
customer_reviews.author: A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: large handles
customer_reviews.text: The handles are a bit larger than other kettlebells I've used. The coating is super slick too and there isn't any texture to the handle. But you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Returning...All chipped
customer_reviews.text: I’m returning this kettlebell because it is all chipped. For the price and for being brand new, I will buy a nice kettlebell that actually looks new!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Be wary if you have small hands
customer_reviews.text: The bell is compact and well made but the handle on the 35lb bell is a bit wider than I expected. It's not that terrible because kettlebells call for a somewhat loose grip, but it made the callous effect much worse. I had to buy mava gloves to reduce the tearing.
customer_reviews.author: Prime User

customer_reviews.title: The little things make a big difference
customer_reviews.text: The handle design and coating on this are far superior to cheaper kettlebells and that makes a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: DWB

customer_reviews.title: A Staple in my Fitness Program
customer_reviews.text: For a couple months now, I have been doing kettlebell swings as part of my exercise regime. To put this in perspective, I am over 65, female, and not a fan of lifting weights. I do half an hour of cardio on the bike, then three sets of thirty swings with the kettlebell, and that's it. I love it! It is not boring, and it seems to work my core very well. My back and stomach feel stronger and a lot more toned. A word of caution--do your homework well on technique so you do not get hurt. Even better, work with a trainer (though, I did not).
customer_reviews.author: BMitchell

customer_reviews.title: Happy husband!
customer_reviews.text: He is trying to start a mini gym for himself so I bought his first item. I hate buying things for him because they always end up not being used. This is the first time I bought something he loves and takes with him to work out every morning
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Barr

customer_reviews.title: Three different ones defective
customer_reviews.text: I tried 3 different ones of this -- all of three of them were defective. The first came damaged; and the second two had rough bumps (NOT by design) on their handles which could lead to injury of the hands when the kettlebell is being used. Will have to go with a different brand or design.
customer_reviews.author: Light Lavender

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality & Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This is to get my kids to do a little work on explosiveness at home. Give 'em a few fun exercises and see some improvement. The kettlebell is now recognized as the most versatile training tool out there. I looked at the CAP product at our local sporting goods store (national brand name starts with Sports, ends with Authority). Choice was $40 plus tax or Amazon for about half that price. Outstanding buy, just one warning - I'd stay away from kettlebells with plastic coating, it just breaks off eventually. This is perfect, all metal.
customer_reviews.author: Got Influence?

customer_reviews.title: best option out there.  nice smooth finish and handle shape.
customer_reviews.text: I like the smooth surface and handle shape. I started with two (2) 35 Kettlebells and quickly moved up to (2) 45 kettlebells. I still use the 35 kettle bells for high reps and warm up. I just wish kettlebells cost less. I want heavy kettlebells for deadlifts. I just don't know how long they will stay in good shape. only time will tell. I bought cheaper kettlebells and its not worth the money saved since those handles are a little too rough for swinging motions and cleans.
customer_reviews.author: RICH

customer_reviews.title: I like this Kettlebell
customer_reviews.text: There really isn't much to say: this is a solid, study Kettlebell. It is well constructed, the entire surface is nice and smooth (but not slippery). I have large hands, so I have to hold it with my pinkie-fingers outside the handle (for the two-hand swing), but that's how I would normally hold a Kettle bell regardless (and honestly I can't think of any Kettlebells I've used where the handle was large enough to accommodate both my hands anyway). I haven't weighed it, but it feels like it weighs 45 pounds;I know I certainly feel bad for the poor UPS guy who had to deliver it, lol!
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: I like these CAP Iron kettlebells with black enamel
customer_reviews.text: I like these CAP Iron kettlebells with black enamel. I have not seen a broken one yet, except for chipping paint. They should last forever I hope, and they are not expensive, and the shape is simple and good. Since they are black enamel on some kind of iron, I'd hope that they can be touch-up with some kind of black enamel or touch up paint. The paint is nice and glossy, but it does chip occasionally. Expensive is of course relative to your budget. Now, exercises are another matter!
customer_reviews.author: T. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.text: The package itself was fairly beat up when it arrived, but the product inside was in perfect condition thanks to the styrofoam holders. This kettlebell has quickly become my favorite piece of workout equipment and I find myself picking it up and doing reps whenever I have a free moment. It has held together very well, with a solid grip and the black finish remaining spotless/uncracked. You can't beat the price and the free shipping. I plan on ordering another heavier CAP kettlebell as soon as the one I have no longer presents a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for some exercises, not so good for others...
customer_reviews.text: I love using kettle bells and this one is no exception. The only thing I have noticed is that when you start using heavier kettle bells you are limited in your exercises. It's harder to do curls or overhead presses because the heavier bells press against your forearms and start to hurt after awhile. You can do hammer curls with ease. Just make sure to watch out for those exercises where the main weight of the kettle bell gets close to your forearms. For those exercises it would be better to use dumb bells.
customer_reviews.author: Rod C.

customer_reviews.title: Handle chipped during shipping
customer_reviews.text: Product came quickly and was as described, but as soon as I opened the box I noticed that the coating on the handle was chipped, and quite badly. It's obviously a heavy item, and not really worth the trouble to me to return it for this defect. However, I chose this kettlebell because of the coating, so to have large pieces missing before I even used it was disappointing. It doesn't seem to affect use too much, but still, I feel like it's not too much to ask that the product not be damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small grip space
customer_reviews.text: The handle has a pretty small width. My wife can’t fit her hands side by side without wrapping her 4th and 5th fingers around the curves. The handle has some gashes and a few burrs. But they aren’t noticeable during swings. Great workout tool
customer_reviews.author: waveman222

customer_reviews.title: ... got this and another 45lb kettle bell for the great price of $1 a pound
customer_reviews.text: I got this and another 45lb kettle bell for the great price of $1 a pound. The weight, balance, and handles are good but the coating on the handle is insufficient. When I first got them, I did a few exercises and didn't have a problem. Yesterday I did 50 snatches on each arm and wore the coating right off the handle. It is very rough and not something I want to deal with. I am going to return them now and spend a little more on bells with a better coating.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: good product, great price
customer_reviews.text: The finish shown in the product photos is quite a bit more glossy appearing than the actual product. This is actually a good thing, because you don't want the surface to be slippery when wet. The free prime shipping and purchase price sold me on these CAP kettlebells. The only major drawback, and this is of greater concern as you go up in weight, is that they use the same size handle on all their kettlebells. It is a bit too small to get a secure 2 hand grip. If you have larger hands, it will be nearly impossible to do a 2-handed swing. Other than that, they are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald F. Luning

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews on people complaining about the bells being chipped and painted(in that order). But all I can say to that is, "And?" It's a kettle bell. It looks awesome since it's as black as the darkest metal you could possibly listen to while thrusting it around. I really don't understand why so many people gave so many bad reviews on a piece of exercise equipment not looking "cute." I highly recommend it and if you have Amazon Prime, you are not going to beat that shipping price. Even the local big box stores I went to couldn't compete with this.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D. Shields

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, low price.
customer_reviews.text: It's essentially a cannonball with a handle. Checked the weight and it is right on. Cheaper than local stores and fast Amazon delivery. After 1 week, I've already chipped the paint in a couple places, but I expect workout gear to get a little beat up. Like weight plates, I will use it and respray it whenever it requires it. We picked up the 25 pound size as a starter for our home gym, and have already added a 10 and a 15. Will continue to purchase other sizes as needs dictate.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wilbourn

customer_reviews.title: Great kettlebell for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is my main kettlebell that I use for most everyday exercises. I have a larger bell that I use for kettlebell sport training, but for the fitness side, this is what I use. The weight was very close to the 35 lb advertised. (With "economy" kettlebells the weights often vary quite a bit). I like the size of the smaller handle (compared to some of the wide handled kettlebells) as it makes one handed swings less awkward and fits/feels better in the rack position. Great kettlebell for fitness and for getting started in kettlebell sport!
customer_reviews.author: Seth J

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, very happy.
customer_reviews.text: These kettlebells are a great quality and value. The enamel on mine seems like it will hold up to a moderate beating, the handle is a little smaller/narrower than i'd really like but only a smidge, the enamel feels slightly grippy on my hands and I feel pretty secure swinging it around. The packaging was a box in a box with some padding around it. I felt a little bad for the mail carrier dealing with so much dense weight but all the packaging was intact and solid with no damage.
customer_reviews.author: David A Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: It's great and I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I don't want to go all the way to the gym and sometimes I get there and everything I want to do is crowded with hulking squatters that don't want to budge for the pope himself. On those days I rely on my kettlebells and calisthenics to get my pump on and this kettlebell is what I use most! It's great and I highly recommend it :)
customer_reviews.author: Ajh

customer_reviews.title: Bad Surface paint issues
customer_reviews.text: These are nice to use but were delivered with bad surface paint defects. We had to use a black sharpie to semi cover the terrible paint job. We didn’t want to send back and wait for others so we settled.
customer_reviews.author: John

product_meta.title: Cap Barbell Enamel Coated Cast Iron Kettlebell
feature_bullets: VERSATILE : Kettlebells offer the ability to target specific muscle group exercises or a full body workout
CONSTRUCTION : Made of solid high quality cast iron with no weld, no seam casting and coated in an industrial powder coated finish for enduring protection

FEATURES : Generous wide opening handle ensures a comfortable, secure grip with one hand or two. The flat bottom allows for easy, safe storage and the ability to be used in specific flat bottom kettlebell exercises such as renegade rows and handstands
FUNCTIONAL : Perfect for swings, deadlifts, squats, get ups, snatches and other athletic or cross training workouts
CHOICES : This kettlebell group from CAP is available in sizes from 5 lb to 50 lb in 5 lb increments and from 60 lb to 80 lb in 10 lb increments

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
